description: Before you can send test messages to a verified destination phone number you need to opt-in the verified destination phone number. Creates a new text message with a verification code and send it to a verified destination phone number. Once you have the verification code use  VerifyDestinationNumber to opt-in the verified destination phone number to receive messages.

parameters.name: VerifiedDestinationNumberId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the verified destination phone number.

parameters.name: VerificationChannel
parameters.description: Choose to send the verification code as an SMS or voice message.

parameters.name: OriginationIdentity
parameters.description: The origination identity of the message. This can be either the PhoneNumber, PhoneNumberId, PhoneNumberArn, SenderId, SenderIdArn, PoolId, or PoolArn.

parameters.name: Context
parameters.description: You can specify custom data in this field. If you do, that data is logged to the event destination. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: DestinationCountryParameters
parameters.description: This field is used for any country-specific registration requirements. Currently, this setting is only used when you send messages to recipients in India using a sender ID. For more information see Special requirements for sending SMS messages to recipients in India. (string) --- (string) ---

nested_items.name: MessageId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the message.
